Master Answer:
The Human Papillomavirus (HPV) Vaccines work to protect both women and men against 2 or 9 types of HPV. The vaccines stimulate the immune system to make antibodies and memory cells against HPV. The menstrual cycle has no impact on the safety and effectiveness of the HPV vaccine.
Immunization Nurse
Master Question: can i get the hpv shot when i'm on my period
